website_summaries.verdict: Absorbent, comfortable cloth pocket diapers at a great price. You get 6 pocket diapers, 6 washable inserts, plus a bonus package of 10 more inserts. Snaps adjust to fit babies from 8 to 40 lbs., and there are several color combinations available.
pros: Adjustable to grow with baby, these pocket diapers have waist tab overlaps to fit even a very small waist
Soft organic cotton is gentle against a baby's tender skin, and the microfiber inserts are very absorbent to help trap moisture
cons: Some parents felt these diapers leaked more often than other brands

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I began my cloth diaper journey 6 months ago and purchased around 24 diapers from 4 different brands here on Amazon, LBB, Lilbits, Alva, and Baby goal. These were all in the same price range. I started using them all at the same time and rotated them evenly. These have held up better than all of the other brands! Many of the other diapers need the elastics replaced, but these are still in perfect condition. I purchased the bundle of solid colors and the material is better quality than the other brands as well. It is sort of like a canvas type material. From my experience, I am very pleased with the performance of these.
customer_reviews.author: lilymom1113

customer_reviews.title: No hold
customer_reviews.text: ****Edit to add***** I spoke with amazon. It’s been almost a year since I’ve had these and they were still gracious enough to allow me to send them back for a full refund. These hold nothing. I’ve tried several things. Doubled up inserts, changed more frequently, tried them with the baby instead of the toddler. They have no hold whatsoever. I have other brands of cloth diapers and they hold A LOT! Even overnights! I really wanted these to work...but, for us, they didn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Red~

customer_reviews.title: Still using them on baby number two...
customer_reviews.text: I give these diapers 5 stars. I bought them for my daughter when she was about 6 months old. I decided to give cloth diapering a try. I used the inserts that came with them (microfiber). The only time I had leaking problems was when I didn’t have them fitting properly. My mistake. I used them until she was around 20 months old. I’m not using them on my 4 month old son and they’re still holding up really well. I actually bought more of them because I liked them so much. I had friends who had spent hundreds of dollars on the more popular brands and I felt that the quality was just about the same.
customer_reviews.author: Bird

customer_reviews.title: Better than name brands!
customer_reviews.text: Used once and I couldn’t believe how much I LOVE these diapers. I have some Thirsties and Smart Bottom brands but they really weren’t nearly as absorbant as these are. When they first arrived, I wasn’t expecting to like them but once I got the fit figured out, they were AMAZING for my newborn (9lbs). SO easy to clean and the whole pack is the price of one of the other diapers but lasted way longer! ZERO leaks or problems. My husband still prefers disposables but only because they have the pee strip and these diapers are so absorbant, it’s really hard to tell when they’ve been wetted. Definitely buying more!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality & quantity!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking the inserts might be harder to deal with than covers & inserts.... I was wrong. These are my favorite diapers I have to use and they seem to be stain resistant. I using the same 6 every day. I was them every night and they are holding up great. I don’t seem to be having issues in any way with them at all. I did replace the inserts with ozocoozy cloth inserts instead though. Only switch I made. I also picked the more gender neutral one so that I could use it on the next babies. No need to find more expensive brands when these are perfect and you get more diapers for less!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky M.

customer_reviews.title: Not holding up well
customer_reviews.text: Update: initially loved however with just a little over a month the back stitching where the elastic is at has started to become undone. First I’ve noticed so far, hopefully the only one. Other than this one the others have held up well but as I’ve said it’s only been a little over a month and was hoping to use these to also last a second baby. Original: Love these! These are my second set. Which it came with more prints but they definitely are with the price!
customer_reviews.author: crystal alvarado

customer_reviews.title: Fit great BUT stitching separated quickly.
customer_reviews.text: 1st. We ordered dino design set but they shipped the puppy dog set. 2. The stitching came apart very quickly. We follow a strict wash routine and have some cheaper diapers that wash the same, yet these ones have fallen apart way too fast, whereas the other cheaper ones we have had 6-9 months longer and are still like new! These ones not so much. Besides them falling apart, they still work fine, they just look silly where the seams came apart.
customer_reviews.author: BethanyT

customer_reviews.title: Good diapers. Lack consistency in quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love this diapers! When my son became allergic to disposable diapers, I bought these and they have worked wonders! I have 3 different packs now. My problem with them is that they vary greatly in quality. Some of the inserts are great and work well. Others are not shaped properly and have errors in the sewing. In this pack in particular the dinosaur diaper is so cute and soft! But it is not water resistant at all. Everything just soaks right through. Diapers work great. Wish they were more consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Kweeks

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Cloth Diaper by far
customer_reviews.text: These are easily my favorite Cloth Diapers and they are competing with some “spendy,” diapers such as let’s say Nora’s Nursery & lilhelpers. They’re much softer than both, they don’t pill like Nora’s Nursery, they have the best quality snaps of all my diapers, vibrant colors, wash well, no leaks, no angry red marks, not to mention the unbeatable price! LOVE LBB, wish they sold more colors and prints!!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Ehh
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these when my little had a terrible diaper rash and my Nana recommended me get some cloth diapers. I was thrilled when I first got these. I liked that they had snaps everywhere for adjustability. And they were cute. But that soon changed after my little wore them. The snaps left indentions all over on his thighs especially when he slept and you could tell they bothered him and was uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Krista

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The only issue we have had is some of them have a bottom clasp that will rub on babies thigh. I'm not sure if it's supposed to be that way. It will cause a red mark on his right thigh. They're very easy to clean. And the colors are very fun.
customer_reviews.author: Nicola Sisk

customer_reviews.title: They are good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I am new to cloth diapering. I have 2 sons. One weighs 28lbs he is tall and very lean. My other son is 25lbs and chunky. The diapers fit them both great, they were leaving some red marks but after some adjusting they fit much better. I have had some trouble with my older ones leaking but I suspect it's because he is older so he pees in more volume. I ordered more inserts and will double up on him and see if that helps. I will update in a week or so when I have received them. The inserts are very soft and the diaper shell is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole P.

customer_reviews.title: Would be 5 out of 5 stars if 2 of the 6 diapers were very unsatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: I really need help because one of the diapers are useless I figured all the diapers are made the same the dinosaur print doesn't hold anything I think its a manufacturer error because all the others are made with a waterproof soft fabric and the dinosaur print feels like the same fabric that lines the inside of the diapers ...I hope I could get someone to help replace the one that does nothing...
customer_reviews.author: Tamika_monique

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product but loses leak proof-ness if dried with heat too much, better to air dry outside colored cover, extra inside pad still good absorbency after heat drying. We used for both our kiddos!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Pulley

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I am new to using cloth diapers and these are my first that I've bought. They arrived on time in wonderful packaging. Everything about it was great. I have used them a few times so far with my son and so far everything is going great! I will update with pictures and how they hold up later on. Don't forget to wash your diapers before using them on your baby and that the butt is a more sensitive area. We actually didn't know my son had a scent sensitivity until I washed them with our normal detergent.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: What an excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: What can i say.... but nothing short of an excellent product. We have been using this set of diapers for almost two years... they haven't lost the quality at all. The inner pads are quite resilient i must say. Ours are used everyday and washed everyday. The set has saved us ALOT on buying disposable pampers... i would say at least by 50%... in some cases, more!!! Of course, our part in terms of how we care for them has had them retained their look and quality. So if you buy them, please care for them, they're certainly an investment worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Allan Doolam

customer_reviews.title: and the "6 pack bundle happy endings charcoal
customer_reviews.text: Getting started w cloth diapers: I bought these (the least expensive), and the "6 pack bundle happy endings charcoal..." and the "Charcoal Bamboo All in One..." all on Amazon. I like these the best. My son is long and lean, and these stretch nicely and fit smoothly against him keeping him dry. The other brands are bulkier so they pucker a little and leak more. These wash easier than the other diapers too, because all of the inserts are totally removable and can dry separately where as the other ones I have to turn inside out to get them dry. I have had them a few months now and will be buying another pack.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Richter

customer_reviews.title: Work well & economical!
customer_reviews.text: I have several sets of these. The main benefit is they are very economical compared to other cloth diapers. These last a long time with regular washes. I have used them for 11 months now with a fairly small supply. The only downside is the inserts do not work for overnight or heavy wetters, you have to use something with bamboo or better yet, hemp. But I still highly recommend these, especially for someone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: We bought these diapers in September 2017 when my son was 6 months old. He wore them until he potty trained. Now my 2nd son is wearing them. I have to say these diapers are very long lasting... it may be cuz I hang them to dry and use a gentle laundry soap. They get washed seperately from the pads since I use vinegar on those and I don't want to ruin the elastic.
customer_reviews.author: PJOSEPHSON

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers for my 18 month old!
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to cloth diapering and this was the first set I bought to see how I liked doing cloth etc. So far I love them! My son is 18.5 months old and about 20lbs. These fit him great and I think he'll be able to wear them until he's potty trained! I hear lots of people talk bad about microfiber inserts but so far we've had no issues. My son can wear these diapers with just the microfiber inserts anywhere from 2-4hrs before a change. Which is fine with me. I did go ahead and order some bamboo inserts so we can try cloth overnight though.
customer_reviews.author: Shanika

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT but
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how many stars this product has!!! I bought these a few years ago for my first baby- they leaked constantly- and i chalked it up to inexperience on my end .. put me off cloth diapers as a whole. I did save them and now I’m running into the same problem with my second kid and this time I KNOW its the diaper. They leak constantly- in fact I’m not even convinced that any layers on the diaper are waterproof. They are just crap diapers. Save your time and money and buy something else because these are not it!
customer_reviews.author: raj

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend these. I have been using them for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend these. I have been using them for a little over a month and while I also use 7 other brands of cloth diapers this one leaks at the seams, it took me awhile to realize that unlike other brands the plastic lining inside the pockets that is supposed to prevent leaking once a pad is saturated does nothing. I poured water into a diaper to test it and the water ran STRAIGHT THROUGH THE DIAPER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using them for one day with my 11 month old and so far no complaints. No leaks here, even with just one insert at nap time. When there was a poopy, I just lifted it out on the disposable liner and threw it away as planned. (10 of these are included to try, I'll have to buy more.) I boiled the inserts for 30 minutes as I heard this makes them more absorbent. Colors are very cute.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Cox

customer_reviews.title: Overall good
customer_reviews.text: Overall these are great, I have had 0 issues with leaking. My one and only complaint is the elastic around the thighs is very, very tight! My daughter is 2 and is on the small size, she wears an 18 months in clothing and weighs 23 pounds, and still the elastic was tight to the point of leaving marks on her skin. Thankfully I have a good sowing machine and was able to fix the elastic issue.
customer_reviews.author: InkedApple83

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers! They're soft, don't leak or blow out, and super easy to clean. I love them so much I have them listed on my blog, ([...]). I use them them on my 3 and half month old twins, and have been using them since they were a month old. Having twins means they get washed a lot, and they have been very durable. Great customer service also! Two of the diapers had damaged back elastic, I wrote the company and they responded within minutes and I already have my replacement diapers! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ColoradoFam

customer_reviews.title: Great buy! Can't wait to purchase more!
customer_reviews.text: I do cloth diapers with my 10 month old son when we are at home. I have a few of the well known brands. I wanted to try these out based of cute design and price so far I've washed them twice in about a week and they seem to hold up great and I'm really liking them and can't wait to but more!
customer_reviews.author: The Standards

customer_reviews.title: Hated these.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry, but these were terrible for us. They were the first cloth I ever bought, so when they leaked within seconds after each time my <1 yr old daughter peed, it was very discouraging. I thought maybe we didn't have the right inserts. Then when they kept leaking on the sides in the crotch, I thought maybe I was putting them on wrong. Nope, still leaked. Then I thought it was the washing method, but I seeked help and it still didn't help. Only solution? Buying completely different cloth diapers -Bumgenius with Alva inserts. No leaks ever again.
customer_reviews.author: N&AFord

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I loved using this Cloth Diaper. Since my baby is too small I couldn't use it during first 6 months. Since 6 months old I am using this for my daughter. I also bought Alva baby cloth inserts and Dandelion Diapers liners. Perfect combination. Liners help in cleaning the poop. Just have to flush it. Diaper is leakproof to some extent. If the pee is more it might get wet too but, by then you would replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Bhavana Jain

customer_reviews.title: Don’t let the bad reviews fool you!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t let the bad reviews fool you! If they are having problems with leaking they are doing something wrong or not changing enough I only use 1 insert in the picket during the day and an insert in the pocket and one between the diaper and my baby at night and he sleeps through the night without and leaking when he wakes up these are just as good as the expensive brands!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! I started my daughter on them at 1
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I started my daughter on them at 1.5 months old (her little butt was too small for them until then!) I haven't had any problems with leaks for pee and it holds well for poops (credit that to properly prepping the inserts - I washed in warm/hot about 8 times in a row, drying them after the 4th wash and then putting them back in for additional washes prior to using them). I bought 3 sets of these and would highly recommend them for anyone who is looking to use cloth diapers. They are inexpensive and work just as well as the Bumgenius ones that I have.
customer_reviews.author: Amy N.

customer_reviews.title: Good diaper, runs slightly small
customer_reviews.text: These are just slightly smaller than other brands in the same price range. Just makes it weird to button and baby will outgrow a bit faster. Absorbency isn't amazing, mostly have to use 2 inserts at once, but this is also true of comparable brands. Like the solid print and I am satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lara T

customer_reviews.title: Great Affordable Pocket Diaper!
customer_reviews.text: I've been very happy with these diaper so far! We made the switch from prefolds to these pockets because of the attractive price point, and I'm so glad we did. Not only are they well made, but they are comparable quality to Bumgenius. Turns out you don't have to spend a fortune initially to cloth diaper, plus these are easy to use and easy to clean. The only down side to this product is the microfiber insert. They don't clean as easy and they gave our little guy diaper rash. We instead use the I would recommend this to anyone new to cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Great to start cloth diapering
customer_reviews.text: So far I have bought Alva, happy flute, fuzz bunz, and some other brands. These LBB diapers are the best ones. Most cloth diapers are adjustable for different sizes, but these have adjustablility around the thigh too. They are easy to clean, soft and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany M-S.

customer_reviews.title: Economical and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Great price, easy to use and clean. No blowouts so far or rashes. Highly recommend! Has hip snaps, as well as rise settings, and cross-over snaps to make fitting a small baby easier. Note: They will be bulky on your baby. They are pocket diapers, and they are cloth. There is no getting around the "bubble butt" look without sacrificing absorbency, which you do not want to do-unless you enjoy constant changes and even more laundry. Remember to prep the covers and inserts ahead of time. Covers only need one go-through, while the inserts should be prepped 4-6 times before use. (The more they're prepped, the better they absorb.)
customer_reviews.author: Gretchen

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has been using these diapers for years with her girls. Now she has a son, and wanted a more masculine print. She was delighted with this gift from Grandma! The diapers are useful both by the ability to change sizes by the choice of a snap, and by choosing the number of inserts placed in the diaper as the child grows. Easy to wash and dry (by machine or line). Cheerful designs and colors. Easy to purchase extra inserts when desired. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Knitting Granma

customer_reviews.title: Quality lacking
customer_reviews.text: These a great for those on a tight budget. The PUL does not hold up that well though especially with compression. You’ll have constant leaks at the legs and the front. I recently switched to Bumgenius and they hold a million times better even with a sopping wet insert! Don’t expect these to hold well unless you plan to change every hour. If you want something better save up for better quality diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth more than their purchase price
customer_reviews.text: These are about to see their third baby and are still in excellent condition. I haven’t had to replace the elastic yet. The only negative I have is that they come with microfiber inserts. I’ve had to replace them with something better absorbing
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: 😁😁
customer_reviews.text: They excelente for this pandemic. Now we don’t need to go out to buy diapers this are very good and very easy to wash. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Good value cloth diapers
customer_reviews.text: I really like these as an intro to cloth diapering. I wish I could give like a 3 and 1/2... After 3 months of use they are holding up nicely, though there is already noticeable piling of the inner fabric. It is still soft, but not as soft as other diaper brands that sell for only slightly more money. Avoid any of the minky/plush type styles! These tend to wick liquid from the liner into the outer cover. The inserts hold up well enough, but again, for slightly more money there are definitely better options. I think this brand works noticibly better for smaller babies and I’m overall very happy with how they have held up.
customer_reviews.author: matthew

customer_reviews.title: Do not fit newborns
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not one size fits all, they're huge. These in no way fit my 4 week old baby, and he is not even a small baby. They are too big and gape at his legs, even when folded down to make them smaller. Had to buy newborn sized ones to fit him. I went with imagine baby products brand and their all-in-one diapers work great.
customer_reviews.author: CHodges

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but not durable
customer_reviews.text: I had this product for three weeks now and one of the diapers lost its elasticity and popped while washing in the washer. I loved the product when I received it but I'm scared all my other ones will lose its elasticity soon :( my other cloth diapers from other companies are lasting way longer than this one without any issues. Unfortunately I'd be looking into other cloth diapers for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as some other budget brands available
customer_reviews.text: The material quality seems to be comparable to other brands - not quite as soft. However, the thin microfiber inserts aren’t as absorbent as the ones that come with other cloth diapers so I don’t use these inserts. Also, some of the diapers have one leg that is looser than the other which has caused leaking so I don’t use all 6 of the covers either.
customer_reviews.author: Deidre

customer_reviews.title: I loved these. I'm not a fan of the minky ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved these. I'm not a fan of the minky fabric personally, but all of the diapers seemed to be good quality, have lasted many many washes (I hang dry the non-minky, and dry the minky in the dryer), and haven't lost any snaps or anything. I think this is a great economy choice for the CD-mom who doesn't have an endless budget to spend on their CD stash. If you don't love the microfiber liners, I feel like even for this cost, it wouldn't be a huge deal to buy other liners. The free gift flushable liners were actually nice to try out as well, and are really handy for those extra heavy messes.
customer_reviews.author: Jestimous

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS. LEAKS. LEAKS.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed in these diapers!!! I received these as a gift at my baby shower and was SO EXCITED to get them. I have just now gotten to use them and they are AWFUL, only 1 of the diapers actually work. Everyone of the others leak so bad :( even with 2 inserts. The waterproof barrier just doesnt work. I did exactly as directed prior to first use to no avail. They have such CUTE designs which makes me so sad.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Tungate

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, functional, and cute!
customer_reviews.text: These are great cloth diapers. I think ours came with a wet bag, too. The designs are adorable, the fit is very good, they come clean easily and dry quickly. We have had no problems with stains or stink. The elastic over the pocket keeps it from leaking from the top. The leg elastic is stretchy and sturdy, allowing him to move freely without leaking from the sides. I would buy these diapers again.
customer_reviews.author: notinksanymore

customer_reviews.title: Too tight around the leg for my toddler...
customer_reviews.text: Five stars for cloth diapering...who knew I'd actually love it (and love saving some money on diapers)! But, I am a little disappointed in the covers because they are just so tight on my son's legs that they are leaving marks. He's 21 months and I was hoping to be able to use these until he was potty trained, as other reviews and the description seemed to indicate. I'm going to try another brand because I do like cloth diapering vs. disposables.
customer_reviews.author: Christin

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as we were hoping for.
customer_reviews.text: I have different types of cloth diapers. Bum Genius, GDiapers, Sweet Pea, Thirsties, Fuzzy Bum (I think that's what they are called?), Charlie Bananas, etc.. I think these are a cross between the Charlie Bananas and Bum Genius. I was so excited to try them! You can't beat the price. Unfortunately, they seem to leak a LOT. They do not have enough absorbency, so I had to purchase extra liners. I've tried readjusting the size to prevent leaks, no luck so far. I think I would buy them just for around the house during the day, they are good for that. Not good for over night or out and about in public.
customer_reviews.author: FirefighterCin

customer_reviews.title: Not cut the same as alva smaller weird cut.
customer_reviews.text: Bad cut not comparable to Alva at all.smaller and tighter leg area. Not worth the cheaper price just get alva and know that you have to strip your diapers every three months this is not negotiable to prevent ammonia burns on baby from urine buildup over time.
customer_reviews.author: Honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Cool that you can adjust the snaps for growing baby. Didn’t use that much but they’re nice colors and quality but after washing the insert they just look like they have lint on them and you don’t want to wash over and over again especially if they poop. Just use diapers. Sorry earth.
customer_reviews.author: Demitria

customer_reviews.title: Fleece lined...brilliant
customer_reviews.text: I have been using other brands that I really like for the past so many months. I wanted to add a few more to the pile so I don't have to wash so often. I didn't even realize these were fleece lined until they arrived. I only wish I had ordered these sooner. The extra fleece liner catches any leakage and so far he hasn't peed through as many diapers as the others that don't have a liner.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: New review
customer_reviews.text: So I am re-writting my review because of an error on my part. The cloth liners that I previously thought were not included are inside the diapers packaging and the side package of disposable liners is a bonus. So the diapers themselves feel like they are a great quality as well as the cloth liners inside. I do not know yet if we will be using the disposable ones that came with but its a good option to have I guess. We have not washed them yet as the baby isn't due for a few more months. I might post an additional review after washing.
customer_reviews.author: Gary H.

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great diapers
customer_reviews.text: Started cloth diapering with these and so far so good. These cloth diapers were an amazing deal, love that they came with inserts although I will admit I love flour sack towels so much better. They fit my 18lbs baby just fine definitely give them a try especially if you're on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good diapers!
customer_reviews.text: Great diapers! They dont leak and I've been using them since my baby was a couple weeks old. I've bought 12 of these and thinking about getting 6 more. UPDATE-We're 10 months into using these. We only use disposables when we leave the house. These diapers are LEAKING... not through the sides but straight through. I wash them in warm/hot water and dry them on medium and then low because I was worried I'd ruin them. Well... I'm disappointed. I did buy 12 total and now I'm down to 6. I guess I just throw them away? Bummer. So I'm going to buy a different brand now.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are perfect and the liners were great for the first few months of use. Liners are now still in great shape but as my baby needs more absorbency during the night, I purchased some thicker pads. I’d buy the pack again though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great selection of pocket diapers for the price. The inserts are of cheap quality. But even after purchasing bamboo inserts separately, the cost is much cheaper than paying $12+ for each for other better known brands even on sale or flash sales like Zulily etc. Loved the fact the crotch area is smaller than other huge diapers. Makes for a more comfortable fit for the baby. Great fun patterns. No leaks overnight either in the two weeks of use. Fits well on the lowest setting on a 13 lb, 3 month old.
customer_reviews.author: Witchkraft

customer_reviews.title: Ok....
customer_reviews.text: Liked these diapers enough. However the elastic on the back, where you stuff the inserts did stretch out IMMENSELY. I was pretty disappointed in thag, considering I used their care guidelines and everything. They lasted about 4 months of cloth diapering my baby.
customer_reviews.author: Sizemore Family

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers for larger babies
customer_reviews.text: The diapers arrived individually wrapped and looking great. The fabrics look sturdy, and I especially love the feel of the soft fabric used for the dinosaur cover. The inserts are super soft and appear to be very absorbent. Unfortunately, despite that I read reviews that claim these diapers work well for very small infants, they are much too large for my 7.5lb tot. The leg gaps are huge, which encourages leakage. As such, we have yet to use them...
customer_reviews.author: Amy Nuzzo

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these diapers since just a couple weeks after our baby was born. He's 5 months now and we are still loving these cloth diapers. And yes, we have tried other brands. These are not quite as bulky as some others, have strong snaps with lots of sizing options, and have a cute, modern look. They do get way more absorbent with the more wash cycles they go through. They have washed really well and we have bought several packs to stay stocked up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont leak at night with my toddler. Love them.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is almost 3 and potty trained during the day. At night she still needs a diaper. I really wanted to try these because I am expecting another baby. I love them. They do not leak at night and fit her great at 28 pounds. Pampers were leaking every night. I will be using them with the next baby.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Dow

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very new to cloth diapers and these are a great starting set. My baby is almost 7 months old and doesn't pee as frequent as a newborn so honestly 6 diapers for the day is enough.( he wears disposables at night) I wasn't a fan of the microfiber, but if you get these cheap and get flour sack towels and use those as inserts you won't have a problem. And my baby is 22 lbs in 12-18 month clothes.. He's chubby and these have so much room to grow!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Really?
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these diapers but they just don't work and smells are hard to get rid of. My child pissed right through these and his pajamas like nobody's business. He was soaking wet. So, I'm going to pass on this nonsense... Good luck! 🤣 And I did wash these prior to using.
customer_reviews.author: The Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: These diapers do not work well while our son is sleeping at all. Peed out of them on 3 separate tries. During the day when he’s walking around, they have worked OK, but what’s the point if you have to change the diaper every time you put your baby down to sleep?
customer_reviews.author: CannedIce

customer_reviews.title: Works well and doesn't stain
customer_reviews.text: These work well and don't stain. I put 4 stars because the microfiber inserts that are included don't work well for longer periods of time because the liquid squished out. We use the bamboo 5 layer inserts and those work well. We've used the insets in the pocket and just sitting inside the diaper. It's easier to send them to daycare with the inserts already in the pockets, but sometimes at home we just lay the insert inside the diaper. It really doesn't matter because the inside of the diaper doesn't stain.
customer_reviews.author: megan

customer_reviews.title: You "and your kiddo" will LOVE these!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely happy with my purchase of these cloth diapers. They are so absorbent and incredibly soft. My 18 month old loves them too. The only thing I found a bit irritating is one of the inserts unraveled at the seams after two washes. But that doesn't take away from how amazing the diapers themselves are.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: Love these, second time purchasing!
customer_reviews.text: These are so great, I purchased them again! I love the colors and they seem as good as any other brand but at a much smaller price. Many cloth diapers range in the 10-15 per diaper. These come in at just 6 dollars a piece. It is a huge savings for a great product! The diapers are extremely adjustable, allowing for a better fit on my growing baby. So far I have had the first 6 for 2 months and they seem to be holding up well, wash after wash. The included inserts are a little thin, however, I just double up or use my bum genius.
customer_reviews.author: Stach

customer_reviews.title: No longevity, otherwise great
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have a lot of money to spend on diapers and these seemed to be really good and affordable, so that's what I bought. Worked really well and I enjoyed the adjustability as my little boy grew. But my son is now 20 mos and 2 of the diapers elastic around the leg opening have given out completely. I was really hoping these diapers would last through potty training and maybe even a 2nd child, but I guess in regard to longevity you get what you pay for :/
customer_reviews.author: german chick

customer_reviews.title: Adorable!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are so cute! I thought my friend was crazy for wanting to use cloth diapers, but after buying these, I am seriously considering it. Most of them have somewhat of a nylon material, but two of the design ones have this, almost velvety, soft material on the outside. They also come with a large cotton piece napkin that you put in the middle, that's easily washable. The clasps on the side make it so that it can either fit a small, or a larger baby. I am very happy with this product. Hope my friend is too.
customer_reviews.author: Vanya_Jelezarova

customer_reviews.title: ... don’t have much to compare with but I really like them. The quality in the diapers and the ...
customer_reviews.text: These are my first reusable diapers so I don’t have much to compare with but I really like them. The quality in the diapers and the liners are great. My only issue is I don’t like how my little one stays moist and kind of sweaty. I have to use barrier cream to keep him from chafing or getting sore. Other than that I like them a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Emilee Leopold-Gallt

customer_reviews.title: Love these. I've bought 2 sets now and will continue to as needed.
customer_reviews.text: I've used much more expensive and much cheaper cds. These are my favourites. I do use bamboo inserts with cotton inserts and a fleece liner for daytime, and I add a thick microfiber pad inside for nighttime. I wash every 2 days at least, sometimes daily, in HOT water. They hold up great. I use baking soda often in their wash loads. I like Purex laundry detergent for these.
customer_reviews.author: HGP

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two packs, and 12 extra bamboo inserts. We wash every other day and that works for us. They are cute, fit well, leak rarely (big pees or big poops are the only time if we don’t catch it fast enough but you’d get that with any diaper). We have two Bum-geniuses and there are no major differences other than the button simplicity (bum genius is a little more simple)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Will buy more soon!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers have been great so far! New to cloth diapering but these diapers have made the experience a very stress free process! The prices are affordable and the diapers do what they should! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Venable

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE the price and diapers
customer_reviews.text: There is so many all in one diapers these days. We bought these ones because they are the Alva brand. We have heard so many good things about Alva and these do not disappoint. We use these with hemp inserts that we bought seperately. They fit snug on your baby with out leaving marks on their thighs. This is a huge plus. You want that snug fit with out causing them discomfort. For the price you cannot ask for more. We have had no leaks or blow outs. We have one happy baby!! I wish we had these for the other 3 kids.
customer_reviews.author: Summer M Bert

customer_reviews.title: Good diapers
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. I have a few different pocket brands and they all came with microfiber inserts which don't absorb well in my opinion so I end up using prefolds as an insert. The inserts included with these diapers are a combo of materials and are very absorbent but continue to feel dry on my baby's skin. My son is about 14lbs and they fit him well. They do have sizing options to make them much smaller than a lot of the one size diapers on the market, I imagine they could fit a baby at around 7 or 8lbs and would just be a bit bulky. I'm going to buy another set.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Zajac

customer_reviews.title: Buy different inserts
customer_reviews.text: Great for cloth Diapering... but get different inserts. Microfiber is so bad for holding pee.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ann Berry

customer_reviews.title: Elastic is stretched out after a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had these diapers for a few weeks and the elastic is already stretched out on several of diapers. Disappointing as I was thinking of buying another set of these to add to my stash.
customer_reviews.author: Shay B.

customer_reviews.title: missing inserts and material change
customer_reviews.text: I use this brand of diapers for my 4 month old and have enjoyed them. This package however was different. They forgot to send the inserts that were supposed to be mailed with the diapers and two of the diapers seemed to be a different material. I ended up returning them to order a different type and it seemed difficult to try and get the inserts shipped separately. The number was a foreign number and would not dial.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Love them, as they can be used for both boys and girls. Even though they come with their liners, I bought it along with the charcoal bamboo reusable liners with gussets and the GroVia bioliners that are flushable. I just flush the bioliner, rinse the bamboo cloth liner and this shell with warm water, squeeze out the water and throw it in the washer. Perfect replacement to disposable diapers. I still use disposable diapers when we are going out. Use cloth diapers at home.
customer_reviews.author: Ciby Narayanan

customer_reviews.title: Not sure on my feelings on these.
customer_reviews.text: I had a bit of trouble with these. My son has quite chubby thighs and I had trouble getting the snaps to sit in a way that the cover was snug on his waist but not too tight on his poor little thighs without havivg gapping.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great for the value
customer_reviews.text: No issue first time using reusable diapers and these were great. Adorable and easy to adjust. Love that they came with the inserts every absorbent
customer_reviews.author: cristine h.

customer_reviews.title: I've been cloth diapering for several years and would compare ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been cloth diapering for several years and would compare these to the bum genus. It's not the exact same, but for the price they're a doupe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 1 month down , no complaints - but extra inserts if using everyday
customer_reviews.text: Used for a month Great way to save some money And be eco friendly Do the multiple times soak , wash at start to increase absorption Then whdn used on baby I change less than 2 hours Once I kept it for over 3 hours it was stinking a bit , not awful tho but poor baby
customer_reviews.author: Ed20

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain, but fit and absorbency compromised
customer_reviews.text: The patterns are cute and snaps allow the diapers to grow with your baby. However, after a year of using these diapers, the elastic around the legs are not as snug as they should be and caused a lot of leakage during the day. While these diapers were a great bargain, after using them a while, we noticed a clear difference in the absorbency and fit between these and the more expensive brands we had.
customer_reviews.author: Kdawgsquared

customer_reviews.title: great alternative to disposables
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as spares when I was running low on my other reusable nappies. They were going to be a backup, but they're really good and now we use them in preference to the other, more expensive brand. I really like the smaller environmental impact of the reusable nappies and cleaning them really doesn't take that much effort. They're much cheaper than disposables and my son has fewer rashes. The only downside is the large amount of plastic wrapping- it goes against the idea of being more environmentally responsible.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a newbie into cloth diapering so I wasn't 100% sure what to expect, but I must say that I'm pleasantly surprised. I prepped these and like I do my Kawaii's and I have had no leaks. I can fit to liners (1 CB and 1MF) in here and they still are on the trim side. my guy isn't a heavy wetter so I use these as our overnight diapers. I don't own any "high end" diapers, and I don't see the need to, these have not delaminated on me, nor do I have leaks. Going on 7 months in rotation.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren King

customer_reviews.title: Great cloth diapers love them!
customer_reviews.text: I like these pocket diapers. It’s is affordable comes with inserts. Cute patterns and vibrant colors. I haven’t had any leaks with these. I’d say it’s comparable to those expensive cloth diapers. I really like these I’d purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Lyca Vermillion

customer_reviews.title: the diapers feel nice and the inserts feel thick as well
customer_reviews.text: Date 3/22/18: Due in July 2018 so I cannot attest to wear quality, sizing, or washing durability. All I have now is that the print is very cute, the diapers feel nice and the inserts feel thick as well. Will update with usage later!
customer_reviews.author: megan bowman

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent, soft, cost efficient, fits great.
customer_reviews.text: When i went to change my son this felt more dry than his diapers. It fits amazing. I didn't have any leaking. I'm seriously in love with these diapers. They are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Athena Vastardis

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Just as expected and they fit my large 21 month old with ease! I recommend these to anyone who wants a more affordable cloth diaper option -you don’t need to buy the expensive ones if you don’t want to.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Not for Small Babies
customer_reviews.text: Update: While these did not work well when baby was small they are great now. I definitely recommend, great product for the price. I like the idea of these but they just don't work for smaller babies. I'm really hoping by 10 lbs I can get them to work. My daughter was born 5.5 lbs and is currently around 7. The leg gussets are not tight enough and they are super bulky on her.
customer_reviews.author: Desi Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Still great after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for almost 6 months. They are fantastic! I have prefolds with covers, aio's, and a lot of the "expensive brands" and these are still my favorite! Snaps are still strong, elastic has held up well, no stains, no problems! At night I do put a hemp or bamboo liner under the microfiber to prevent leaks. I have two sets of these (along with about 40 other diapers) and they are my #1 go to! Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I tried to use these, but they're just so ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use these, but they're just so difficult. The locking system is confusing and they look very uncomfortable. It's difficult to load the pads into the diapers, and while it is possible to use the pads without using the inserts... This makes it difficult to keep the pad stay put in the diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Leak!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these a while back and despite the fact that they are durable and can stand being washed several times during the week, they leak around the legs! I'd washed these along with my Bum Genius and Alba diapers and they'd always disappoint so it wasn't a matter of stripping them . The pockets are big enough to slide the inserts but the diapers narrows down so it was difficult to add more than one insert. They're cute but I wouldn't buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: These diaper covers are huge. I love them and so do my twins. The elastic is not horribly tight, there's a lot of snaps on them to customize the size of the cover itself, and they're nice and soft on the edges so there's no odd fitting into the thigh area. Speaking of soft, the inserts that come with these are remarkably soft and thick. I wish i could buy this exact brand and style of inserts in packages.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Cowles

customer_reviews.title: They arrived quickly and are in good shape. No tears or stains
customer_reviews.text: My LO is due in September. Will update my review once he is here and can't fit into the diapers. For now my review is based on shipping and how they look. They arrived quickly and are in good shape. No tears or stains. Update: my son is almost 6 months now and we love these! I suggest getting different inserts to use, just because microfiber is prone to compression leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Poff

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t used these yet. My daughter-in-law hasn’t had the baby yet but the reviews were so good. They are so cute and practical and the seller is wonderful! I ordered ordered at late night/ early morning and received the same day!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Cloth lining is useless
customer_reviews.text: The outside cloth diaper itself works great. But the insert lining doesn’t absorb well and it causes diaper rash. I know it causes rash because we use the charcoal cloth lining and it’s never causes diaper rash.
customer_reviews.author: zoeyzoey

customer_reviews.title: It leaks always
customer_reviews.text: It always leaks always. We tried to place the insert inside the pocket and outside and still leaks every time. Terrible product
customer_reviews.author: Sajith

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers
customer_reviews.text: These are great- excellent value and quality! Wee bought a second batch after trying these. They wash well, have plenty of snaps to adjust (we transitioned to cloth once our baby got to size ones. I liked that they are gender neutral and patternless. No leaks after several months of use and no diaper rash issues either.
customer_reviews.author: Profplaydoe

customer_reviews.title: Best diaper for an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing especially for the price!!! I started out using these and have gone back to them after trying other brands and styles. They have never leaked and my son appears to be comfy when wearing them. The snaps make it harder for him to undo so that is plus!
customer_reviews.author: kendra Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Cloth interior! You can't wipe clean the inside!
customer_reviews.text: For me personally, these cloth diapers just get one star due to their cloth interior. You can't wipe them clean, so I'm assuming you'd need to change and wash them with each diaper change. However, they are well made and according to reviews other mamas really like them. Hence, three stars. I returned them and got two BB2 wipable diaper for $8.15 each.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Ojeda

product_meta.title: Baby Double Rows of Snaps 6pcs Pack Fitted Pocket Washable Adjustable Cloth Diaper(Netural Color)6BM98, AMGrey, One Size
feature_bullets: Three rows of adjustable snaps to allow for a small/medium/large size in one diaper
Hip snaps to prevent the sides from drooping
Waist tab overlaps for extra small waist size

specifications.Additional product features: Adjustable snap, Waterproof, Reusable, One Size, Washable
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,756 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
